task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robotic arm, following sequential perception, approach, verification, grasp, and lift phases as visually grounded in the frames.

task_long_description.overview: The episode documents a robot arm performing a pick-up task in which it must locate and grasp a red cylindrical object placed on a table. The scene contains blue markers and the red object, with the robot approaching, aligning, and grasping before lifting the object off the table. Each stage maps to a specific action or condition in the behavior tree. The process is designed to be robust, using retries for perception and stable sequential execution.
preconditions: Red object is present and accessible on the table
Robot arm has unobstructed access to the workspace
stepwise_plan: Ensure red object is visible or attempt visual reacquisition
Detect precise location of red object
Move above the red object at a safe offset
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Close gripper to grasp the object with minimum allowed force
Verify the object is in gripper
Raise the object to clear the surface
success_criteria: Object is lifted above the table
No collision or drop during the process
failure_and_recovery: Perceptual failures trigger up to 3 reacquisition attempts
If grasp fails, sequence halts after unsuccessful verifications
If object not detected in gripper, does not proceed to lifting
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates when the object has been grasped and lifted above the table.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible to sensors
Initiates search pattern to visually locate the red object
Performs object localization for the red object
Opens gripper to preset width for approach
Moves manipulator above red object at safe hover offset
Approaches and aligns to red object with precise tolerance
Closes gripper with gentle force to grasp red object
Verifies the red object is held in gripper
Lifts the grasped red object a set vertical distance

failure_modes: Object slips from gripper during lift
recovery_strategy: Fallback to scan if object not visible
Up to 3 retry attempts for object detection
No lift if object not secured in gripper
assumptions: Red object in frames matches the instruction target
No move or place action observed; last frame, object is held above the blue marker, not moved elsewhere
Instruction is interpreted as picking up (not relocating) the object

expected_success_criteria: Red object successfully grasped and lifted off table
